CatDescriptText: Mrs. Sally Washington, 6609 Bower St., East Liberty, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 26, 1957, pg. 4, with question: "Do you believe we should have a state law forbidding strikes of trolley cars, buses, and taxicabs?" answer reads: "Yes, there certainly should be a state law forbidding such strikes. A strike, like this street car strike for instance, causes everybody to lose money and everything else."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Sally Washington wearing striped head scarf, holding Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, umbrella on wrist, and bucket handbag, standing next to telephone pole with sign that reads "...der ...terfield", with Sam's store advertising "North Pole Real Ice Cream" in background
